channel.title: The newNPC method
channel.description:
99% of you will find a method in your npchandler.java called "newNPC". Just to remind you all, this is how you spawn an npc...which is pretty self explanatory. You would use it like you do your autospawn: [code] server.NPCHandler.newNPC(int npcType, int x, int y, int heightLevel, int rangex1, int rangey1, int rangex2, int rangey2, int WalkingType, int HP, boolean Respawns); [/code] npcType = the ID of the npc. int x = spawn point x. int y = spawn point y. int heightLevel = height level of spawn point. int rangex1 = highest x range of walking ability. int rangey1 = highest y range of walking ability. int rangex2 = lowest x range of walking ability. int rangey2 = lowest y range of walking ability. int WalkingType = 0 for no walking, 1 for 1 squares monsters, 2 for 2+ squared monsters. int HP = monsters hitpoints. boolean Respawns = respawn time, -1 for no respawn.
[b][u]This could be very useful for quest developement.[/u][/b]
Just I've noticed a few questions about this here...and this really isn't a tutorial, just a reminder with explanation, so I posted it here.

item.title: The newNPC method
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

99% of you will find a method in your npchandler.java called “newNPC”. Just to remind you all, this is how you spawn an npc…which is pretty self explanatory. You would use it like you do your autospawn:

server.NPCHandler.newNPC(int npcType, int x, int y, int heightLevel, int rangex1, int rangey1, int rangex2, int rangey2, int WalkingType, int HP, boolean Respawns);

npcType = the ID of the npc.
int x = spawn point x.
int y = spawn point y.
int heightLevel = height level of spawn point.
int rangex1 = highest x range of walking ability.
int rangey1 = highest y range of walking ability.
int rangex2 = lowest x range of walking ability.
int rangey2 = lowest y range of walking ability.
int WalkingType = 0 for no walking, 1 for 1 squares monsters, 2 for 2+ squared monsters.
int HP = monsters hitpoints.
boolean Respawns = respawn time, -1 for no respawn.

This could be very useful for quest developement.

Just I’ve noticed a few questions about this here…and this really isn’t a tutorial, just a reminder with explanation, so I posted it here.

Read full topic
